text.title: Unclog a Toilet with Dish Soap

p.s: A clogged toilet is something we 've all experienced : the rising of water to the brim , the sense of panic as it does n't stop , the scurrying for the plunger .
But dish soap is a simple solution that can bring you back from the fate of a flood of toilet water with nothing but your favorite product and some hot water !
Whether you start by pouring the boiling water into the toilet or adding dish soap , if all goes well the end result is unclogged piping .

head.s: Soaking the Bowl in Boiling Water

item.s: Locate the toilet flapper and stop water flow from the tank .
Remove the lid from your toilet tank and locate the toilet flapper .
The flappers are typically black , blue , or red and provide the seal for the flush valve .
Either close it using the chain attached or with your hands .

figure.rend: Unclog a Toilet with Dish Soap Step 1.jpg

item.s: To prevent water supply altogether , turn the handle behind the toilet near the floor in a clockwise direction .
If you 're having trouble turning the handle , apply an oil spray .
Do n't worry about contaminated water in the toilet tank — germs do not enter this part of the fixture .
If you 're worried , wash your hands thoroughly afterward .
Boil a pot of water .
Turn your stove on high heat and place a water-filled pot onto the stove .
Then , cover your pot with a lid and wait for the water to boil .
You can also fill the pot or bucket with hot water from the tap , but make sure it 's as hot as possible — the higher the temperature , the more effective it will be at fighting the clog .

figure.rend: Unclog a Toilet with Dish Soap Step 2.jpg

item.s: If you only have a smaller pot or bucket , fill it up multiple times until you have about of boiling , or very hot , water .
Pour of hot water into the bowl .
Pour gently and make sure the water does n't pass the rim .
Be careful not to spill any to avoid burning yourself .
If your bucket has a metal handle , hold it up with one hand and tilt the bucket with your other hand by turning it from the bottom .

figure.rend: Unclog a Toilet with Dish Soap Step 3.jpg

item.s: Wait for the water to rise to the rim after pouring the water .
Pour about of dish soap into the water .
The dish soap will float to the bottom of the bowl because it is heavier and denser than water .
Let the soap sit for about 20 to 30 minutes .
After this time , the water should lower .

figure.rend: Unclog a Toilet with Dish Soap Step 4.jpg

item.s: Always pour the water slowly and be careful not to overflow the bowl .
Pour another of boiling water into the toilet .
Fill another pot with hot water and place it onto the stove to boil .
Again , hot water is also effective , but boiling water is always ideal .

figure.rend: Unclog a Toilet with Dish Soap Step 5.jpg

item.s: Turn the stove on high heat for the fastest results .
Continue pouring water into the toilet and let it sit .
After about 2 to 3 rounds , flush the toilet to check if the clog is gone .
Be sure to give each of boiling water about 20 minutes to settle .

figure.rend: Unclog a Toilet with Dish Soap Step 6.jpg

item.s: Wait overnight if your toilet is still not flushing properly .
If it 's not unclogged in the morning , try using a plunger .
if it 's still clogged .
Even if you 've already tried to plunge the clog , dish soap can weaken it , so it 's always worth a second shot ! Place the plunger into the bowl and aim it at the hole .
Press down sharply in short , fast strokes , and be sure to lift sharply to create suction .
After 4 or 5 full strokes , lift the plunger on the last upward motion

figure.rend: Unclog a Toilet with Dish Soap Step 7.jpg

item.s: Run the plunger under hot water for 30 seconds prior to plunging to warm the rubber up .
If the clog still does n't come loose , call a plumber .
